fields.description:
h6. Issue description
Can't buid app on Android simulator via Genymotion, here is the error: 
{code}
[ERROR] Application Installer abnormal process termination. Process exit value was 1
[INFO] :   
[INFO] :   Alloy compiled in 0.58322s
[INFO] :   Alloy compiler completed successfully
[INFO] :   Launching emulator: new
[ERROR] :  Unable to start emulator "new"
[ERROR] :  Unable to find Genymotion "player" executable
2016-01-12T22:09:38.240Z | TRACE  | titanium exited with exit code 1
ERROR  | Error: ti run exited with error code 1
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (/Users/Rick/.appcelerator/install/5.2.0-55/package/node_modules/appc-cli-titanium/plugins/run.js:92:66)
    at ChildProcess.emit (events.js:110:17)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (child_process.js:1074:12)
2016-01-12T22:09:38.242Z | TRACE  | Sending exit signal to titanium process:  3234
{code}

h6.Steps to reproduce
# Create a default classic application 
# Run in any android simulator
# Simulator is not starting


** Error log and appc info attached.
fields.summary: Android:  Unable to start emulator using Genymotion
fields.environment:
Mac OS 10.11.2
Node 0.12.7
npm 2.11.3
CLI 5.0.5
TiSDK 5.1.1.GA
Genymotion  2.6.0

comments.body: This is not happening if the simulator was manually started before build.

Don't know if this is related, but the latest Genymotion version changed the location of the executable:
https://community.appcelerator.com/topic/4355/unable-to-start-emulator-google-nexus-5-5-1-0-api-22-1080x1920
Closing ticket as duplicate of TIMOB-20130.
